title: Business Live: Netflix shares at record high - BBC News

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for tonight - thanks for reading .
we 'll be back bright and early tomorrow form 06:00 .
please do join us if you can .

documents.title: netflix and chill for us stocks
text: the s & p 500 and nasdaq composite indexes have finished at record highs ( again ) , helped by a surge in shares for video streaming site netflix .
upbeat results last night from netflix saw its shares jump 10 % to take its market value past $ 100bn .
but the dow jones index of us stocks was hemmed in by declines for consumer goods giants johnson & johnson and procter & gamble .
the dow jones fell 3.79 points , or 0.01 % , to 26,210.81 .
the s & p 500 gained 6.17 points , or 0.22 % to 2,839.14 and the nasdaq composite added 52.26 points , or 0.71 % to 7,460.29 .

documents.title: sky deputy chairman stays postive
text: one of sky 's senior directors remained in positive mood tonight as he told the bbc that a regulator 's preliminary decision to block fox 's takeover of sky was not the end of the world .

sir martin gilbert said he was confident the deal could still go through if the company were to offer further concessions to reassure the regulators that there was not too much concentration of power in the uk media .
failing that , he said , there are two other options : spin off sky news with a cash dowry to keep it going for five years ; or shut it down .

given that sky news is loss making some investors may prefer that option - as having jettisoned a unit that loses an estimated £ 50m a year - it might allow sky shareholders to ask for a higher price for their shares from disney who are due to complete a takeover of fox .
the markets seemed to agree that today 's ruling was not a setback for sky .
shares rose more than 2 % .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: microsoft boss : 'world needs more computing power '
text: the world is rapidly `` running out of computing capacity '' , the head of tech giant microsoft has warned .
satya nadella said at the world economic forum in davos that superfast quantum computers were needed to solve some of the most difficult problems .
mr nadella cited the quest to create a catalyst that can absorb carbon , in order to help tackle climate change .
this , he cautioned , would likely not be achieved without an increase in computer processing power .
read more

documents.title: disney latest to pass on tax savings to workers
text: yet another us firm has promised to pass on savings from donald trump 's tax reforms to workers .
walt disney said it would give 125,000 employees a $ 1,000 bonus , and put $ 50m into a new programme to help cover tuition fees for staff .
earlier jp morgan and verizon made offers on the back of tax savings , and there have been similar moves from at & t , fiat chrysler , comcast , jetblue and walmart .

documents.title: shares in consumer goods giants slide
text: shares in consumer goods giants johnson & johnson and proctor & gamble are struggling .
j & j shares fell 4 % after it reported a $ 13.6bn charge related to the new us tax law .
a court ruling on a crucial patent on its popular arthritis drug remicade also spooked investors .
procter & gamble , which owns brands like oral b and ariel , fell 3.4 % after reporting a drop in its gross margins .
both are weighing on the dow jones index , which is struggling to hold onto monday 's gains .

documents.title: tariff on solar panels 'will hurt us industry '
text: donald trump 's decision to place tariffs on imported solar panels will kill tens of thousands of jobs , raise the cost of going solar and quash billions of dollars of investment , the us solar energy industries association has warned .
on tuesday mr trump put a 30 % tariff on panels that will decline over four years .
abigail ross , president of the trade group , said : `` it 's just basic economics - if you raise the price of a product it 's going to decrease demand for that product . ''
seia expects 23,000 jobs in manufacturing and installation to be lost this year , with more losses in subsequent years .
the us solar industry employs more than 260,000 workers .

documents.title: regulator warns on proposed atm shake-up
text: the head of the payment systems regulator ( psr ) has said that new proposals to shake-up britain 's atm network have not been thought through .
link , which manages the network , says there are too many cash machines in places where they are not needed .
however , consumer groups have warned its proposals would lead to mass closures of free-to-use atms in remote areas .
psr boss hannah nixon said of link 's proposals : `` we expect them to continue to fill the gaps in the network and put more money on the table to do just that .
if that is not what we see , we will intervene . ''
the psr has powers to suspend changes , if need be , she added .
nicky morgan , head of the treasury select committee said : `` any significant reduction in free access to cash would be an unacceptable outcome .
we think a moratorium will be needed if those concerns do not disperse . ''

documents.title: us stocks set fresh records
text: despite a relatively quiet trading session , all the major us share indexes chalked up fresh records on tuesday .
a short while ago the dow was up by just 0.01 % at 26,217.48 and the s & p 500 had gained 0.3 % to 2,840.26 .
upbeat earnings from netflix also spurred gains for the technology sector , with the tech-rich nasdaq rising 0.7 % to 7,457.12 .
so called faang stocks - facebook , apple , amazon and google parent alphabet - gained between 0.7 % and 2.2 % , and netflix itself rose by up to 11 % .

documents.title: verizon promises stock giveaway after trump tax cuts
text: verizon will give most of its employees 50 shares in its company following expected savings from donald trump 's tax reforms .
the firm said tax cuts would boost its operating cash flow by $ 3.5bn to $ 4bn this year .
the shares , which will be given to staff other than top management , will be priced on 1 february .
at their current price of around $ 53 , the award would be worth about $ 2,650 per employee .

documents.title: sky-fox deal talks 'makes game of thrones look like the teletubbies '
text: that 's how former managing editor of sky news has described the complexity of the talks between fox and sky on a planned takeover deal .
it follows a ruling by the competition regulator today that fox taking over sky would not be in the public interest on grounds of media plurality .
that raises questions over the future of sky news .
last november sky said it would consider selling off the news operation if it was hindering the deal .
but lis howell , who 's now director of broadcasting at city university , told 5 live she 's confident the future of sky news is secure .
`` it is so complicated with all the interaction between the companies , particularly in the states . ''
she added : `` i personally believe sky news has always been protected by the murdochs .
`` rupert murdoch is extremely fond of sky news and set it up as his own project . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: nations to sign tpp trade deal without us
text: eleven mainly asia-pacific nations have agreed to sign a major trade deal , despite the us having backed out of the pact .
officials said a statement of agreement on the trans-pacific partnership had been struck and it would be signed next month .
us president donald trump abandoned the tpp in january last year calling it a `` job killer '' and throwing the pact 's future into doubt .
the deal covered 40 % of the world economy before the us withdrawal .
countries now set to join include japan , australia and canada .

documents.title: netflix shares outpace goldman
text: after announcing a huge increase in subscribers last year , netflix shares jumped as much as 11 % today .
the video streaming platform is not only the best performing stock in the s & p 500 this year - its market cap is also now higher than investment bank goldman sachs ' .
netflix 's market cap has surged past that of goldman sachs
goldman is more like `` silverman '' now .
i 'll show myself out .
well the growth is higher at netflix .
it 's business is far more stable ( goldman is in essence a giant hedgefund ) .
goldman 's content is too derivative
just goes to show how overvalued it has become .
not just @ twitterid to worry about vacuuming up freshly minted # mba , now banks must worry about @ twitterid too ?
can u live without netflix ?
can you live with out goldman ?
no surprise there
not surprised just brilliant
what 's its loss per new subscriber acquisition ?
looks like bitcoin : - )

documents.title: children 'need to play more to gain work skills'bbc business reporter tweets
text: playing is one way children develop workplace skills # wef18

documents.title: ftse 100 closes higher
text: london 's blue-chip index has closed slightly higher thanks to rising oil prices and a strong performance by easyjet .
the ftse 100 gained 0.2 % to 7,730.32 points .
easyjet was the best performer , up 5 % , after ryanair 's pilot shortage and the demise of competitor monarch paved the way for a strong first quarter for the budget airline .
sky also gained 2 % after regulators ruled its takeover by fox was not in the public interest .
miners were among the worst performers , with bhp billiton , fresnillo and anglo american all losing more than 2 % .

documents.title: 'optimism reminiscent of last financial crisis ' - barclays boss
text: the newfound optimism about the state of the global economy is eerily reminiscent of the lead-up to the last financial crisis , the head of barclays has warned .
`` i do feel like that it is a little bit like 2006 , '' jes staley told delegates at the world economic forum in davos .
`` when we were all talking about whether we had solved the riddle of economic crises . ''
but he said big banks were now in a better position to deal with shocks .
read more

documents.title: p & g trying to stop teens 'chewing ' its laundry soap
text: procter & gamble says it is increasing efforts to counter a potentially fatal trend for teens ingesting its tide detergent .
at least 10 deaths have been linked to the craze , in which young people film themselves chewing and even swallowing laundry detergent pods , then post the videos online .
the pods contain ethanol , polymers and hydrogen peroxide and are extremely toxic .
p & g said it was working with social media companies to remove the videos showing these activities , and has joined with other organisations to spread the word about the dangers .

chief financial officer jon moeller said : `` our standards and protocols for safety are stringent , our labels and warnings are clear , but they ca n't prevent intentional abuse fueled by poor judgment and the desire for popularity among peers . ''

documents.title: pound passes $ 1.40
text: the pound has hit its highest level since the eu referendum , touching $ 1.4019 against the dollar .
analysts credited the weak dollar which fell during this week 's us government shutdown and is yet to recover .

documents.title: kleenex-maker to cut at least 5,000 jobs
text: kleenex-maker kimberly-clark has said it will close or sell 10 manufacturing plans and cut at least 5,000 jobs , about 12 % of its workforce .
the move comes as the texas company struggles to lift sales .
in the fourth quarter of 2017 , sales rose by just 1 % .
kimberly-clark said the restructuring programme would streamline its supply chain , saving at least $ 500m by the end of 2021 .
the savings are in addition to a plan to reduce costs by $ 1.5bn in that time .
read more

documents.title: pound 's strength 'may be short lived '
text: sterling is still hovering around the $ 1.40 mark ( $ 1.39920 ) after briefly passing it on monday night .
that level has not been seen since the eu referendum .
but trevor greetham of royal london asset management says it 's more to do with the weakness of the dollar than progress in the brexit negotiations .
if the recent strength in sterling were linked to progress on brexit , you 'd envisage seeing uk interest rate expectations rising , relative to the us .
in fact , the reverse has happened .
the dollar has weakened despite a marked increase in us interest rate expectations relative to the uk and other countries .
this creates the risk of a snap back in the dollar and a sudden drop in the pound , regardless of the state of the negotiations in brussels . ''

documents.title: us stocks mixed in early trade
text: there was a mixed start for wall street on tuesday , although stocks were still close to record highs .
a short while ago the dow jones and s & p 500 indexes were flat , while the tech heavy nasdaq was up 0.5 % .
netflix shares were up by about 11 % after the firm reported membership had surged past 117 million last year .
twittter shares fell by 3 % after chief operating officer anthony noto announced he was resigning .

documents.title: 'it 's all about the conditions of leaving eu ' - ghosn
text: commenting further on brexit , mr ghosn said the fact the uk was leaving the eu was not good or bad in itself - it was more about the conditions of leaving .
`` competitiveness relies not only on tariffs , on movement of goods and people , but also strength of currency .
all the issues need to be taken into consideration .
`` hard or soft brexit are more political terms .
as business people , we look at specific elements . ''

documents.title: 'we do n't know what brexit will mean for us ' - ghosn
text: car firms renault , nissan and mitsubishi motors still face a `` big period of uncertainty '' over brexit , carlos ghosn has told the bbc .

mr ghosn , who is boss of renault and chairman of nissan and mitsubishi , said : `` we are patient and waiting for the outcome when we have that it will be very important for the decisions we have to make in terms of production in the uk . ''

he added : `` what we are going to be looking at is , is the uk going to be an equally , more or less competitive place to build cars from there , we will take all decisions because we are a large producer in the uk , and we will be watching very carefully how the competitiveness of our facilities are going to be affected . ''

documents.title: 'grey rhinos ' at davosbbc business correspondent tweets
text: black swans '' are making way for `` grey rhinos '' in .
the phrase apparently refers to an economic risk that everybody sees but does n't tackle , until it explodes .
`` we openly admit we have too much debt , '' says fang xinghai , of china 's securities regulator .
# wef18 # davos18
like # sexualharassment .
i 'm a # wef # ygl - tried to speak up about that since 2014 .
over 3 years , tried to launch not just 1 but 3 initiatives on it .
nobody listened .
until the # nytimes included me in their page 1 story on it .
then boom .
# sexualharassment is the `` grey rhino '' that the wef ygl wrongly credited for coining that term also overlooked .

documents.title: jp morgan to invest $ 20bn after us tax cuts
text: jpmorgan is the latest company to pledge more investment in the us following donald trump 's corporate tax overhaul .
the investment bank said it would spend $ 20bn on increasing wages , hiring more staff , opening new branches and expanding its business .
it will also increase small business lending by $ 4bn .
analysts expect jpmorgan to save about $ 4bn a year from new us tax cuts , although some warn big banks will soon compete away '' those savings as they try to take business from one another .

documents.title: elon musk 's boring company presents la tunnel plan
text: elon musk 's boring company has presented plans to build a hyperloop tunnel under culver city , california .
the plans were presented at a council meeting on monday by jehn balajadia , operations co-ordinator of the firm .
she said : `` the purpose of boring company is to alleviate soul-destroying traffic and augment public transit . ''
mr musk , also chief of tesla inc and space exploration technologies corp , did n't speak at the meeting .
read more

documents.title: twitter confirms noto 's departure
text: the social media site has confirmed its second-in-command is going .
in a statement it said chief operating officer anthony noto had accepted the chief executive role at another company ( known to be online lender sofi ) .
mr noto 's responsibilities will be assumed by other members of its leadership team , twitter said .
`` anthony has been an incredible advocate for twitter and a trusted partner to me and our leadership team , '' said jack dorsey , twitter 's chief executive .
mr noto said leaving was `` bittersweet '' .
`` i have the utmost confidence in twitter 's future and look forward to watching the wonderful success the team will continue to achieve . ''

documents.title: twitter coo resigns
text: twitter 's chief operating officer anthony noto has resigned , according to reports .
the company is yet to issue a statement , but rumours of his departure have circulated for days .
on monday , twitter shares fell as much as 3.4 % on reports mr noto had accepted a chief executive role at online lender social finance .
some analysts said his departure would be viewed as a lack of confidence in the company 's turnaround efforts .

documents.title: us imposes new 'america first ' tariffs
text: the us has approved controversial tariffs on imported washing machines and solar panels .
the move is in line with president donald trump 's `` america first '' trade policy , which aims to protect local manufacturers from foreign competition .
producers in china and south korea will be hit hardest by president trump 's trade moves .

documents.title: uk 'can get special brexit deal ' says norway pm
text: norwegian pm erna solberg tells me britain and eu should push for a soft brexit '' .
says seems clear uk does not want norway '' model deal ( membership of the european economic area ) and can get its own , special deal .
but nothing is better '' than eea deal # wef2018 # brexit
it seems like we do n't know what we want ?
tired of the crap just leave and see how quickly everybody does a deal for both sides .
all this crap serves no purpose but give news something to comment on .

documents.title: breakingkimberly-clark to cut 5,000 jobs
text: kimberly-clark will axe around 5,000 jobs , or 13 % of its workforce as part of a major restructure of the business .
cnbc reports that the maker of andrex toilet tissue and huggies nappies will also close or sell 10 of its 91 global production facilities .
the company is aiming to cut $ 2bn in costs by 2021 .

chief executive thomas falk said : `` '' the changes we are making will improve our underlying profitability , provide more flexibility to invest in growth opportunities and help us compete even more effectively , ''

documents.title: razor discounts weigh on proctor & gamble
text: beauty sales made up for discounted shaving gear for proctor & gamble in the second quarter .
the consumer goods group , which owns the gillette brand , reported a 2 % rise in organic sales for the three months to december .
total revenue rose by 3 % to $ 17.3bn .
net income fell by 68 % to $ 2.5bn .
proctor & gamble said organic sales of its skin and personal care products - in particular olay and sk-ii - rose by 9 % .
however , in grooming , revenue shrank by 3 % between october and december .

the company said : `` shave care organic sales decreased mid-single digits primarily due to pricing reductions in the us which were partially offset by volume increases due to reduced pricing and innovation . ''

documents.title: public finances may be improving a bit faster than expected
text: britain 's public finances suggest a slightly faster improvement than expected in november , says the office for budget responsibility .
`` it appears that the underlying improvement in borrowing so far this year is a little faster than would be consistent with our november forecast , '' the obr said .

earlier , official data showed britain 's budget deficit fell by much more than expected last month , helped by an unusually large credit from the european union and the strongest value-added tax receipts on record .

documents.title: european union repeal law lodged in jersey
text: jersey 's external relations minister , senator sir philip baillhache says a new european union repeal law will give the states the ability to decide which eu laws will continue to apply in jersey after britain leaves the eu .
the new law , that be debated by politicians in march , will allow the government to quickly change laws or introduce new laws as a result of britain leaving the eu , sir philip says .
you can read the draft european union ( repeal and amendment ) ( jersey ) law 201- in full here :
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: davos : behind the scenes
text: here 's erna solberg , the prime minister of norway , talking to bbc economics editor kamal ahmed .
ms solberg is at the world economic forum where she has suggested that there needs to be a focus on corruption and illegal money flows .
incidentally , the prime minister is part of an all female line-up that is chairing davos this year .
it is the first time in its 50 year history the event is being chaired entirely by women .

documents.title: davos : dead serious about meatless burgers
text: a burger for breakfast might not be everyone 's cup of tea , but it 's the only way to get to try the vegan meat alternative being served at many of the functions at davos this year .
the vegan patty is made from wheat , coconut oil , potatoes and something called heme which helps to create the red , bloody colour of meat , here with us chef traci des jardins .
the aim of impossible foods founder patrick brown is to make meatless food which tastes better than its alternative for carnivores .
ultimately he says his mission is to completely replace animals as a food product by 2035 .
`` we 're dead serious about this , '' he says .
my conclusion is that while tasty it does n't have the same texture or substance as meat .
but who cares what i think ?
the real question is whether he can convert burger lover donald trump , due into town on friday .
author: Katie Hope
BBC business reporter

documents.title: cold comfort for pensionersbbc personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
text: 1 in 3 pensioners feel under pressure to leave the heating off , 12 % live in one room over the winter
10 % of pensioners often stay in bed with hot water bottle instead of turning up the thermostat , says energyhelpline on basis of survey of 500
my nans house is as hot as the centre of the earth .
she must be loaded .

documents.title: uber plans shake-up of driver ratings
text: uber plans shake-up of driver ratings
author: Katie Hope
BBC News, Davos

documents.title: fewer but better jobs , says sainsbury 's
text: sainsbury 's plan to cut jobs comes just a day after tesco said it will axe 1,700 shop floor roles .
sainsbury 's says that the store manager positions that are being cut will be replaced by fewer , but mostly better paid , new management roles in each store .
employees have the choice of either applying for these new roles , accept a more junior position if unsuccessful , or face redundancy .

sainsbury 's retail and operations director simon roberts , said : `` the proposals will introduce a more efficient and effective structure , designed to meet the challenges of today 's retail environment .
they will deliver cost savings to be invested in our customer offer and in our colleagues as they continue to provide the very best service for our customers .
`` our intention is not to reduce overall headcount as a result of these proposals . ''
he added : `` i appreciate this will be a difficult time for those affected and we will fully support our people through these changes . ''

documents.title: breakingsainsbury 's to cut thousands of jobs
text: sainsbury 's is cutting thousands of store manager posts in a big restructuring of its business .
the changes involve axing a number of management posts in its supermarket and conveniences store across the uk .
sainsbury 's said it could n't confirm the number of employees affected by the move but said it was `` in the thousands '' .
it has more than 1,400 stores in the uk .

documents.title: demand up but so are prices
text: there is good news and bad news from the uk 's manufacturing sector .
the confederation of british industry ( cbi ) said manufacturing grew strongly in january , lifted by demand for exports but many factories expect to raise prices .
in its survey of producers , the cbi found that the monthly order book balance eased to +14 from december 's almost 30-year high of +17 .
economists had pointed to a reading of +12 .
however , the cbi 's expected prices balance rose to +40 from +23 in december , its highest level since january 1984 .
the past depreciation in sterling continues to leave its mark on firms ' costs and margins .
with expectations for factory gate price inflation at their highest in 30 years , the pressure on consumer prices looks set to persist . ''

documents.title: high time for sterling ?
text: for a very brief moment overnight , the pound touched $ 1.40 against the dollar - the highest level since the eu referendum in june 2016 .

sterling is currently trading at $ 1.39510 against the greenback but william anderson jones , head of uk corporate dealing at rationalfx , says : `` with key economic data set for release throughout the week including the uk 's gdp estimate for the fourth quarter of 2017 , analysts will be watching closely to see how the pound reacts . ''

documents.title: admiral emails customers over 'mohammed ' claims
text: admiral has been in contact with customers following reports claiming that the insurer is among a number of companies who charge more to cover a car if the motorist 's name is mohammed as opposed to someone with a more traditional english name such as john .

in an email , cristina nestares , chief executive of uk car insurance at admiral , tells customers : `` you may have seen a story in the news which claims we use customers ' names to price our insurance based on race .
this is 100 % not the case and we do not , and have never , used this information to provide a price to our customers .
i 'm sorry if this story has caused you any concerns .
`` to offer our prices we use a complex rating structure and rate on many different variables and data sources .
the journalists have misunderstood our pricing structure and the insurance quotes in the story are not like for like . ''
read the full story here .

documents.title: in the hands of mickey mouse ?
text: in light of the cma 's concerns about media plurality and fox , it 's worth reminding ourselves just how much of fox that disney wants to buy .
if the $ 52bn transaction goers ahead , sky would transfer to disney .
and here 's a full breakdown of what media assets the murdoch family controls .

documents.title: autonomous taxis in six years
text: the lively boss of @ twitterid # carlosghosn delivering positivity & headlines in equal measure at # davos2018 .
connected cars , autonomous cars , cars without drivers , more electric vehicles , artificial intelligence , robo-taxis , all within 6 years , he thinks
not a chance in hell

documents.title: the sweet smell of musk
text: how do you retain your top talent ?
trust tesla to come up with an audacious and pretty bonkers solution to a humdrum business problem .
elon musk , the man who inspires hollywood plotlines and no small amount of awe in the world of industry , will only be paid if he can make the company thirteen times bigger than it is today .
tesla has set a dozen targets , each $ 50bn more than the next , starting at $ 100bn , all the way to a market value of $ 650bn .
in addition , the company has set a dozen revenue and adjusted profit goals .
it 's similar in structure to how tesla 's rewarded him before .
but the numbers are much , much bigger .
author: Victoria Fritz
BBC Business presenter

documents.title: man united tops rich football clubs list
text: manchester united have topped the table of the world 's 20 richest football clubs for the second year in a row , says deloitte
manchester united plc , a company incorporated in the cayman islands ( i.e .
of the top 10 # taxhavens in the world ) is listed on the new york stock exchange .
the only person holding more than 10 % of the voting rights in manchester united plc .
is the glazer family .
why does table not include debt ?
just asking
pity they are n't close to being the best club on the pitch .
well , not really

documents.title: elon musk 'to be paid on performance '
text: billionaire tesla chief executive elon musk wo n't get any guaranteed compensation of any kind , tesla says in a statement .
he will be paid only if tesla and all of its shareholders do very well .
for one thing , tesla 's market cap will have to increase about $ 600bn in ten years to $ 650bn .
but it 's worth noting that mr musk is not short of a bob or two - he 's worth about $ 21bn , according to forbes .
does he actually need any more money ?

documents.title: japan 's nikkei at another new record
text: the rally in asian markets means barely a day seems to go by without a new record being broken or a landmark being reached .
today , step forward japan 's nikkei 225 index , which gained 1.3 % or 307.8 points to end at 24,124.15 - its highest level in more than 26 years .
analysts say investors were cheered by the us resolving its government shutdown quickly - and the resulting gains on wall street .

documents.title: uber to shake up driver ratings
text: uber 's new boss dara khosrowshahi says it 's planning to shake up driver ratings so customers will be able to opt for a higher service level as well as a nicer car .
# wef18
ubers service is not good in pakistan islamabad becaz of misbehave of the driver day by day
and a higher price to match
i 'd prefer if they sort out the drivers gaming the 'surge pricing ' algorithm !

documents.title: carillion impact on public finances to be announced
text: the office for national statistics said this morning that it will provide an update on the impact that the collapse of carillion has had on public sector finances .

it said : `` following the announcement of the insolvency of carillion plc , the government has stated that it will provide the necessary funding required by the official receiver to maintain public services .
any impact of these financial interventions on public sector finances will be announced in due course . ''
i added : `` carillion held approximately 450 contracts with government , representing 38 % of carillion 's 2016 reported revenue . ''

documents.title: a boost for the chancellor
text: britain 's budget deficit narrowed by much more than expected last month and the data could help chancellor philip hammond meet his latest fiscal targets .

british public borrowing since the start of the financial year in april totalled £ 50bn , nearly 12 % less than in the same period of 2016 and the lowest year-to-date total since 2007 , the ons said .

it leaves mr hammond on course to meet his target of £ 49.9bn in the 12 months to the end of march 2018 - equivalent to 2.4 % of gross domestic product - thanks to stronger-than-expected tax revenues .
figures for january , when self-declared income tax returns come in , are likely to show a budget surplus .
the ons said value-added tax receipts were the strongest for any month on record in december , up by an annual 4.9 % to £ 12.3bn .

documents.title: davos : uber board 'shocked ' at kalanick culturethe times economics editor philip aldrick tweets :
text: marc benioff , founder , chairman and chief executive of cloud computing company salesforce is teasing dara khosrowshahi , the boss of uber , about travis kalanick at a session entitled `` in technology we trust '' at the world economic forum .
benioff and uber 's new boss khosrowshahi fun exchange about kalanick .
benioff : it 's not like the board did not know '' about the kalanick culture .
khoro pushes back .
benioff : .
ok .
the board did not know .
they were shocked .
shocked . ''

documents.title: breakingpublic sector borrowing 'lowest since 2000 '
text: public sector net borrowing decreased by £ 2.5bn to £ 2.6bn in december 2017 , compared with december 2016 , helped in part by a £ 1.2bn credit from the european union , says the office for national statistics .
this is the lowest december net borrowing since 2000 , it adds .
in the current financial year to date , borrowing decreased by £ 6.6bn to £ 50bn

documents.title: davos : the big worry
text: davos : the big worry
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: davos : relying on the regulators
text: barclays chief executive jes staley has faith in financial regulators .
`` on one level , pre-2008 , the regulators were there just to bear witness , '' he tells the wef crowd .
`` today , the political body have told the regulators 'i want you to regulate the systemso you avoid the next financial crisis ' . ''
author: Joe Miller
Business reporter

documents.title: davos : 'we are simply a bank '
text: michael corbat , chief executive of citigroup , tells the crowd at davos that big banks have scaled back their operations , which leaves them less exposed to another crisis .
`` we are not an insurance company , we are not an asset manager , we are not a hedge fund , '' he says .
we are simply a bank . ''
author: Joe Miller
Business reporter

documents.title: davos : collaboration will prevent next crisis
text: the session taking place at the world economic forum on `` the next financial crisis '' is examinng whether `` overheated markets '' are heading for another crash .
barclays 's chief executive jes staley had this to say :
live now : are overheated markets headed towards another financial crisis ?
# financialcrisis @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid says if there 's another financial crisis , there is n't a plan a .
it also takes a long time - a good 8 to 10 years - to recover from one , but he thinks the world economy is in a good place right now .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
@ twitterid we do not know how new things , such as peer-to-peer lending , which have not been through a financial crisis , will cope .
it will be in places that have not seen them that the risks lie .
@ twitterid is right , we do not have a plan for the next financial crisis .
# wef18
jes staley @ twitterid given where debt levels are , i think the capital markets will be tested .
@ twitterid asks if stress tests for banks work .
@ twitterid says they are not perfect .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
fang xinghai : regulators always have to stay alert , despite strong global economy .
are there any asset bubbles ?
on the question of china , if its economy is affected , so is the world 's .
the main problem is too much debt .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
fang xinghai : china debt has plateaued .
lesson from us financial crisis is that we will contain risk from small institutions so they do not spread to the rest of the system and it still functions .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
david rubenstein @ twitterid people are confident that we have no recession problems , but as galbraith said the conventional wisdom is usually wrong .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
david rubenstein : i worry about unanticipated events , so-called black swans , such as conflicts or a global illness .
but the lesson of last recession was buy your own debt back as a low cost .
great fortunes were made .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
jes staley : connectivity between regulators , banks and academics has increased .
not only do they look at what to fix but how to work collaboratively to avoid the next crisis .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
michael corbat : you have to think where we are today .
the us government closed at the weekend and the markets went higher .
the markets are up and if you sell , you buy back higher .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
@ twitterid says when you look at geo-political risk , it means markets are doing well .
but high asset prices at the moment are based on low interest rates and we do n't know how capital markets will respond to changes .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
@ twitterid the biggest systemic risk to markets now is technology .
we are all dependent on a small amount of tech providers , what happens if something goes wrong ?
# wef18 # financialcrisis
adds another risk is regulation : if regulators around the world are all looking at the same things , the real systemic risk is somewhere else .
ef18 # financialcrisis
david rubenstein : harder to spot what will cause a recession than it is to make money from it .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
fang xinghai : china needs to open more to global competition .
@ twitterid what does china need from the us ?
fang : just a normal relationship .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
@ twitterid social fracturing is common after financial crises .
@ twitterid how will we deal with us tax cuts ?
jes staley says tax environment needs to be equalised .
g20 kept regulatory environment about the same .
# wef18 # financialcrisis
asks david rubenstein if he believes in trickle down economics , rubenstein says more money in the middle classes likely to be beneficial .
wef18 # financialcrisis
@ twitterid echoes @ twitterid view on risks from technology to the banking system .
@ twitterid what do you mean by technology ?
@ twitterid connectivity , all the stuff in the cloud , we all use it , but do not really understand it .
what if it goes wrong ?
wef18 # financialcrisis

documents.title: hit in the coffers
text: the maximum stake people are able to bet on fixed odds betting machines could be cut from £ 100 to £ 2 - a move that bookies , unsurprisingly , have been lobbying against .

jim mullen , chief executive of ladbrokes coral , says : `` if it was the £ 2 , you 're looking at probably a £ 1bn tax impact over the next four years to government coffers , wiping out the levy which is the funding of horse racing , which we agreed with racing two years ago . ''
he says the industry recognises `` some of our customers experience problem gambling behaviour '' - which is what the reduction would be aimed at .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: davos : no plan a for central banks
text: harvard economist and davos stalwart kenneth rogoff is also on the `` are we doomed '' side of the panel discussing `` the next financial crisis ? ''
at the world economic forum .
there really is n't even a plan a for central banks , '' in the event of another financial crisis , he warns .
`` we are still at the tail end of the last [ crisis ] '' .
author: Joe Miller
Business reporter

documents.title: carrefour to axe 2,400 jobs
text: french retail giant carrefour plans to offer voluntary redundancy to 2,400 employees at its head office in france , out of total workforce of 10,500 .
it wants to cut costs by €2bn ( £ 1.75bn ) by 2020 , restructure , shake up its store network and speed up its expansion into convenience stores .

documents.title: davos : the next financial crisis ?
text: good morning from davos .

despite the heaviest snowfall i 've ever seen in this swiss town , which caused travel chaos ( at least for those of us not in private jets ) , the mood at the start of the annual world economic forum is upbeat .
yesterday , the imf opened the forum with the strongest global economic outlook for 8 years .
a pwc survey showed that chief executives were in a similarly ebullient mood .
but might davos man be fiddling while rome is about to burn ?
that 's the topic of the session i 'm at now - ominously titled `` the next financial crisis ?
on the panel : jes staley , chief executive of barclays , michael corbat , the boss of citigroup and others .
stay tuned .
author: Joe Miller
Business reporter

documents.title: easyjet flies to the top of the ftse 100
text: easyjet soared to the top of the ftse 100 risers on tuesday morning following strong revenue growth in the first quarter .
its share price is up 6.8 % at £ 16.70 .
sky was among the top gainers , up 2.9 % at £ 10.33 following the provisional findings by the cma into a takeover of 21st century fox .
the ftse 100 is ahead 12.55 points at 7,727.99 .
strong sales at pets at home lifted the retailer to the top of the ftse 250 , with its share price up 7.8 % at 196.30p .
n brown , however , tumbled 11.69 % to 246.20p after it trimmed its forecasts on profit margins .
the ftse 250 is down at 20,610.17 .

documents.title: writing on the wall ?
text: rupert murdoch agreed a deal to sell a big chunk of fox to disney in december .
had he seen the decision by the cma coming ?

media editor amol rajan says : `` i think rupert murdoch and people around him did suspect that there would be a problem , that the murdoch brand and the murdoch family trust were seen as being far too toxic
`` but it all now comes down to whether or not disney and its boss bob iger is committed to not just sky the broadcaster , but sky news which is loss-making , but a world-class product . ''

documents.title: watchdog fines quindell auditor £ 1m
text: the financial reporting council ( frc ) , the accountancy watchdog , has fined arrandco audit , which was formerly known as rsm tenon audit , £ 1m in relation to the audit of financial statements by quindell , the insurance technology and claims management group , for the year to 31 january 2011 .

the frc said tenon and jeremy filley , the audit engagement partner , both admitted `` their conduct fell significantly short of the standards reasonably to be expected of a member and a member firm and that they failed to act in accordance with the icaew 's fundamental principle of professional competence and due care . ''
mr filley was reprimanded and fined of £ 80,000 which was adjusted for mitigating factors and discounted for settlement to £ 56,000 .

documents.title: astra 'not enough for ellesmere port '
text: the new vauxhall astra is due to be built in 2021 .
but the decision where it will manufactured will be made this year and the big question is will it stay at the ellesmere port plant on merseyside .
`` i do n't think an astra alone will be enough to keep the plant going , '' says professor david bailey of aston university .
`` what i think the unions and workers and management are looking for is a range of models that can be built there , including crossover vehicles and sports utility vehicles .
that 's the way the market is shifting . ''
talks have been held between britain 's biggest union unite and vauxhall 's french owner psa group which were `` frank '' but useful , the sides say .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: pampered pets boost sales
text: dogs and cats were well taken care of over christmas if pets at home 's results are anything to go by .
the retailer said like-for-like revenue rose by 7.2 % in the 12 weeks to 5 january .
same store sales of merchandise increased by 6.8 % .
like-for-like sales in services - such as veterinary care and grooming - increased by 10.1 % .
total turnover rose by 9.6 % to £ 223.3m .

documents.title: what about the mouse ?
text: in its report into 21st century fox 's proposed acquisition of the 61 % in sky it does not already down , the cma notes that fox has agreed to sell its business to disney for $ 52.4bn .
it says : `` subject to the transaction being completed , and if the sale to disney completes on the terms proposed , then disney would assume full ownership of sky ( including sky news ) .
it says : `` the disney transaction will itself be subject to regulatory scrutiny , its terms may be varied as a result and it is unlikely to be completed until well after our inquiry has concluded .
`` it is therefore uncertain whether , when or how the disney transaction will be completed . ''

it adds : `` as fox intends to complete the acquisition of the 61 % of sky it does not already own prior to the disney transaction completing , these provisional findings concern solely fox 's proposed acquisition of the shares in sky it does not own and do not take into account the disney transaction . ''

documents.title: davos uncovered
text: what really goes on at davos ?
they all dress in robes and dance around a large fire chanting their allegiance to the dark one
it 's called cronyism
i preferred 'davis ' !
did you mean david davis ?

documents.title: sky shares rise on cma report
text: shares in sky rose 2.34 % to £ 10.26 in early trading after the competition and markets authority found that 21st century fox 's bid to take full control of the satellite broadcaster is not in the public interest .

documents.title: ellesmere port eyes the future nervously
text: union leaders went to paris to talk about the future of the vauxhall car plant at ellesmere port on merseyside with the plant 's new owner , psa peugeot citroen .
professor david bailey of aston business school says the plant `` is in a fight for its survival yet again . ''
`` ordinarily , i 'd say it was in a pretty good position because it 's a flexible , efficient plant at full capacity , but there 's a whole range of factors against it .
`` peugeot looking to make big cost savings after the takeover , that will i think involve plant closures .
it 's easy to fire workers in the uk , and of course , costs are higher because of the depreciation in sterling making imported components more expensive . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: serving up wake up to money
text: wake up to money was not broadcast on radio five live this morning due to coverage of the australian open tennis championship .
catch up with the podcast here .

documents.title: buck stops with hancock
text: so what happens now following the cma 's provisional ruling on the fox/sky deal ?
is it blocked ?
the simple answer is no - at least not yet .
there will now be a three week public consultation where the cma will receive responses to its provisional ruling , says a spokeswoman for the regulator .
after that , the cma will incorporate the responses into a final report , which will be sent to culture secretary matt hancock in mid-may .
he then has 30 days to give a response .
it will be his decision whether the deal is blocked .

documents.title: marston 's sales slip on ice and snow
text: pubs group marston 's profits will be hit by £ 1m for the 16 weeks to 20 january after poor weather impacted trade .

like-for-like sales fell 0.9 % after `` snow and icy weather towards the end of the period , both in early december and between christmas and new year , caused some unavoidable disruption to the business , '' marston 's said .
its chief executive ralph findlay said : `` we are pleased with our progress , which included record total retail sales in our pubs of £ 4m on christmas day - 5.4 % higher than last year .
we continue to achieve growth against tough market conditions and are benefiting from investment in both pubs and brewing . ''

documents.title: sky notes 'possible remedies ' for fox deal
text: sky , the company at the heart of today 's provisional findings by the competition and markets authority , said : `` sky notes the provisional view of the cma , that the transaction is not likely to operate against the public interest on broadcasting standards grounds .

`` sky also notes the cma 's provisional view that the transaction may be expected to operate against the public interest on media plurality grounds , but , at the same time , that the cma has set out possible remedies relating to these concerns , and is seeking submissions on these . ''
it said : `` according to the updated administrative timetable published by the cma , the deadline for its final report to the secretary of state is now 1 may 2018 .

`` the cma states that it has extended the timetable due to the `` exceptional volume of substantive submissions , the need to hold a large number of hearings and the novelty and complexity of the investigation '' . ''

documents.title: breaking21st century fox responds to cma findings
text: 21st century fox said : `` we welcome the cma 's provisional finding that the company has a genuine commitment to broadcasting standards and the transaction would not be against the public interest in this respect .
`` regarding plurality , we are disappointed by the cma 's provisional findings . ''
it said : `` we will continue to engage with the cma ahead of the publication of the final report in may . ''

documents.title: sexual harassment claims 'do not impact broadcasting standards '
text: the cma said when considering 21st century fox 's offer to take control of sky on broadcasting standards grounds : `` the investigation also considered the recent allegations of sexual harassment against fox news employees in the united states .

`` while these are serious , the cma has provisionally found that these are not directly related to the attainment of broadcasting standards and do not call into question fox 's or the murdoch family trust 's commitment to broadcasting standards in the uk . ''

documents.title: murdochs 'already have significant influence over public opinion '
text: the cma said it had not ruled against 21st century fox 's full takeover of sky `` because of a lack of a genuine commitment to meeting broadcasting standards in the uk '' .

elaborating on its reasons for finding that the deal is not in the public interest in terms of media plurality , it said that the murdoch family trust ( mft ) news outlets `` are watched , read or heard by nearly a third of the uk 's population , and have a combined share of the public 's news consumption that is significantly greater than all other news providers , except the bbc and itn '' .
it added : `` due to its control of news corp , the murdoch family already has significant influence over public opinion and full ownership of sky by fox would strengthen this even further .

`` while there are a range of other news outlets serving uk audiences , the cma has provisionally found that they would not be sufficient to moderate or mitigate the increased influence of the mft if the deal went ahead . ''

documents.title: murdoch family 'would have too much control '
text: following an in-depth investigation into 21st century fox 's £ 11.7bn offer to buy the rest of sky - it already owns 39 % - the cma said it has provisionally found that if the deal went ahead , as currently proposed , `` it is likely to operate against the public interest '' .

the competition watchdog said : `` it would lead to the murdoch family trust , which controls fox and news corporation , increasing its control over sky , so that it would have too much control over news providers in the uk across all media platforms ( tv , radio , online and newspapers ) , and therefore too much influence over public opinion and the political agenda . ''

documents.title: breakingfox/sky deal 'not in the public interest '
text: the competition and markets authority says that 21st century fox 's proposal to take control of satellite broadcaster sky `` is not in the public interest due to media plurality concerns '' .
it said : `` the media plurality concerns identified mean that , overall , the cma provisionally concludes that the proposed transaction is not in the public interest . ''

documents.title: strong start , says easyjet 's new boss
text: johan lundgren , who became easyjet 's chief executive in december , said : `` easyjet delivered a strong start to the financial year with a significant growth in revenue in part driven by an increase in passengers flown and strong growth in inflight and ancillary sales as we offer more and better quality options for our passengers .
`` we continue to focus on cost , generating approximately £ 28m in lean savings in the quarter , and we completed our acquisition of part of air berlin 's operations at berlin tegel .

documents.title: easyjet first quarter sales rise
text: easyjet has reported a 14 % rise in revenue to £ 1.1bn for the first quarter and reported a 1.6 % improvement in cost per seat following lower fuel costs and focus on cost controls .
it said it carried 1.4 million passengers in the three months to 31 december .

documents.title: donald goes to the party
text: the people who elected trump would be probably be the most critical of the world economic forum - a champion of globalism .
however , we 'll probably see `` trump triumphant '' at the conference says anne richards , chief executive of m & g investors .

`` he 's coming to demonstrate that despite the liberal elite , if you want to put it like that , coalescing against him , that he nonetheless has demonstrated a fantastic year in markets , '' she says .
`` i think the other part that drives trump is this fear of missing out , '' she adds .

`` the fact that there 's a great big party going on that he may not have had an invite to in previous years - he definitely will be driven by the fact that now he 's been taken seriously , now he 's on the agenda . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: india prime minister to deliver keynote speech at davos
text: india 's prime minister narendra modi will deliver the opening keynote address at davos today .
it is the first time that an indian prime minister has attended the world economic forum since 1997 .
mr modi is expected to talk about the indian economy and the country `` being recognised across the world as superpower , as a great place to do business , and our plans for the next few years '' .

documents.title: pound in touching distance of $ 1.40
text: can the pound breach the $ 1.40 mark today ?
sterling has edged up overnight and is now trading against the dollar at $ 1.39920 .

david madden , market analyst at cmc markets , said : `` sterling has been climbing lately as the economic indicators from the uk have been broadly positive , and the weakness in the greenback has accelerated the move .
`` sterling has been rising against the us dollar for nine months and there are no signs of the trend changing . ''

documents.title: trump expected to talk about us economy
text: thousands of business people and world leaders have descended on davos in switzerland for the annual shindig of the great and the good .

martin gilbert , co-founder of aberdeen standard , who is at davos , suspects donald trump , who is set to deliver a speech on friday , is going to tell the conference `` about how well the us economy 's doing '' .
`` but it 's a surprise , '' he tells the bbc 's today programme .
`` i ca n't imagine what the security 's going to be like . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: blankfein doubles down on france
text: lloyd blankfein , chairman and chief executive of us investment bank goldman sachs , has said in the past that france could benefit from brexit under france 's prime minister emmanuel macron .
on tuesday , he doubled down on that view .
great meeting today with international ceos hosted by pres .
@ twitterid in versailles .
he and his team engaged on how to attract business and investment to france - took all questions for hours .
big effort - sincere and effective .
feels like a new day has dawned in france .
@ twitterid tell us more about the brexit dividend please ?
maybe a dividend could be an economy not reliant on parasites and chancers in the city who have caused a decade of misery to millions of people .
reliant on low wages , no overtime , no statutory holidays , no h & s , no maternity leave , no workers rights , and no nhs .
sound good to you ?

low wages happening now and over the last decade , no employee security , zero hour contracts , , nhs in constant crisis and having to be grateful of whatever slips through the city 's grasping fingers sounds great at the minute does n't it ?
so losing 20 % of our tax receipts is going to be great for us ?
considering may is going to sacrifice the nhs whilst fellating trump how good will life be going forward ?
why would we lose 20 % of our tax receipts ?
seems a made up figure to me .
lots of examples of economies that do n't rely on avarice .
perhaps we should try it ?
how about paying people a living wage as a starter ?
explain how brexit will do that please ?
the financial sector of accounts for 10.7 % of the uk economy and 11.5 % of our total tax income .
explain how losing that , even a small percentage , will help the uk ?
brexit may give us a chance to change our economy in the long term from one where the rich get richer and the poor suffer .
i do n't believe our economy works or has worked equitably for everyone .
mr. blankfein , `` vive la france ! ``
bouncing baby bouncer .
this is called sexy half fair
mutti ist deutsch .
sie sieht nicht sowie aus .
sie hat kein rubato und ist immer ohne scherzando .
her mouth is small enough but her eyes are not large and she is dark so she 's not half doll .
sie wird nie das machen können .

dear lloyd the election of @ twitterid is i am convinced a game changer indeed , for france , for europe and for business leaders worldwide - who need to shortly acknowledge this new reality @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid this is only the beginning : watch the next 10 years !
one investment banker to another .
in 10years macron will be gone , like chirac he 's only there because of the alternative .
and when the alternative becomes reality la france est belle mais ungouvernable .
france is much more governable than the uk these days

i like french maid german maid and citi maid fetish .
do you able dress like those ?
your behavior was very bad this morning we will gang rape you as punishment .
whether or not , i like to step on you and now moreover also to spit on you .
i also have real impact on your profits .
you have cancer in all areas of your body !
i 'm everywhere , princess .
face .
mikes song .
ask the people .
i was even better before .
this is the song .
mike said , `` you have to leave .
it is too unfair . ''

documents.title: tuesday afternoon highlights at davos
text: a session on `` fostering inclusivity '' will be attended by canada 's prime minister justin trudeau .
an interesting and timely session on global rules-based order will include input from robert lighthizer , the us trade representative and arkady dvorkovich , russia 's deputy prime minister .
the new york times , which broke the story about film producer harvey weinstein 's alleged sexual abuse , will co-host a discussion on `` gender , power and stemming sexual harassment '' .
it will be joined by erna solberg , the prime minister of norway and mary callahan erdoes , chief executive , asset wealth management at jp morgan chase .

iain conn , group chief executive of british gas-owner centrica , will examine a `` new era for energy politics '' where he will be joined by fatih birol , executive director of the international energy agency .
pepsico 's chairwoman and chief executive indra nooyi and renault nissan 's carlos ghosn will share ideas on `` towards better capitalism '' .

and later the international monetary fund 's managing director christine lagarde will chair a discussion on the theme of this year 's world economic forum - `` creating a shared future in a fractured world '' - where she will be joined by ibm 's ginni rometty .

documents.title: tuesday morning highlights at davos
text: one of the first sessions of the day at the world economic forum in davos is entitled `` global markets in a fractured world '' .
brian moynihan , chairman and chief executive of bank of america and tidjane thiam , chief executive of credit suisse , will take part in the discussion .
following that , jes staley , chief executive of barclays , will form part of a panel to talk about `` the next financial crisis ?
are the overheated markets headed towards the next financial crisis ?

later dara khosrowshahi , the boss of uber , will join the uk 's sir martin sorrell of advertising giant wpp and ruth porat , chief financial officer of google 's parent company alphabet to consider `` in technology we trust '' .

documents.title: video : what on earth is davos ?
text: not too sure why everyone is talking about the world economic forum in davos , switzerland ?
let this video guide you .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .

it is the first day of the world economic forum in the swiss resort of davos and there are plenty of big names to watch out for including barclays ' chief executive jes staley and uber 's dara khosrowshahi .
look out for tuesday 's highlights shortly .
back in the uk , easyjet will publish its first quarter results and a number of companies will release their christmas trading figures including pets at home and posh mixer maker fever-tree .
and at 9.30am , the office for national statistics will reveal public sector finances for december .
we would love to hear from you .
email us with your thoughts and observations at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
